content.description: The start is a left-hand lieback up the obvious flake.  After reaching the top of the flake, begin friction stepping up to the top of the slab.  This is an excellent route for children and beginning climbers.  Variation:  Instead liebacking up the flake, head straight up the face of the flake.  This variation is rated 5.6.
content.protection: There are two sets of bolts at the top of the route.
content.location: The start is the left side of the obvious flake.  To setup of a TR, head around the left side of the face and scramble up some boulders to the top.

content.description: Starting left of the flake, climb straight up the face of the slab without using the flake.  There is a small lip near the bottom, which can be tricky to pass in places.
content.location: This is the face to the left of Wasp Attack.

content.description: Lieback crack leaning to the right. Continue up the crack and around the right of boulder atop the slab
content.protection: Protect the crack with small-ish pieces. Anchors on top of the boulder above the crack
content.location: Starts behind a long-ish flaky boulder on the ground, on the south side of boulderland. On the other side (left) of the gully with the big chockstones

content.description: Climb up the rounded corner on thin edges.
content.location: The corner to the right of Ay, Caramba.

content.description: Climb the crack formed by the right-hand side of the Wasp Attack flake.  Good hand and finger jams along with some nice edges near the bottom.  You're probably going to want to tape up before climbing this route.
The Southeast face of Boulderland can be accessed from the Mentate parking area via TR #353.  Nearly all of the routes can be easily top roped from bolts.  Most of the rock in this area is excellent.
